JOANNA EDGELL

Front-End Developer

Atlanta, GA

    •

Technical Skills & Work Process

Front-End Development

I create web applications using Javascript, HTML, CSS(SCSS); and libraries such as jQuery, Handlebars, Underscore.js, jQuery UI and Bourbon Refills. I also have experience working with RESTful APIs, Parse Javascript SDK, Backbone.js and some Angular.js

Responsive Design

With the rise in use of smartphones and tablets, applications need to be accessible across a number of devices. I have experience with Bourbon Neat, a front-end framework that allows projects to be built on a responsive grid layout.

Work Process

I use Balsamiq to create wireframes in order to quickly grasp UI experience and improve the functionality of my projects. When working on group projects, and solo projects, I use Scrum to better organize my time and insure I focus on the most important aspects of a design first.

Selected Works

  • Fork & Spoon

    This was a group project where we were charged with creating a website for a fictional restaurant.

    Working on this gave me the opportunity to work with APIs and use Scrum. We primarily used HTML, SASS and jQuery.

    View Live Site

  • Surf & Paddle

    I created a pixel perfect mock up of a website for a fictional business.

    I used HTML and CSS for this static website.

    View Live Site

  • Safety Net

    Safety Net lets parents share their children's medical information privately with other parents. Users can use this information as they plan events to avoid allergens and dietary issues.

    I primarily used Backbone.js and jQuery, with Parse acting as my backend.

    View Live Site
